content:
zk-STARKs work without the trusted setup of a CRS and utilize publicly verifiable randomness. They exhibit more scalability, with proving complexity scaling quasilinearly in response to computation complexity, as opposed to the linear scaling in zk-SNARKs. zk-STARKs prove to be more suitable for applications managing substantial transaction volumes, thanks to their effective handling of larger computations. Despite these advantages, they have a higher verification overhead compared to zk-SNARKs.
